text:
I could not agree enough.  All of the tongue-in-cheek wackiness was just a joy to play through beginning to end.  The game was a bit easy - but I didn't care.  Sometimes the fun factor just overshadows everything else.

I still want to eat an entire cake like Booster.  I will do it!!

text:
I remember this level. It's probably my favorite level because the cloud people and the Mallow's castle of all the great golden statues design just is breathtaking (especially when you're 10yrs old) and seeing all this. 

I always will remember the INN where you get a dream (might a good or scary dream) but it was always fun!

Or the Hot Springs by the Volcano or the Cloud Taxi Ride to Bowser Castle was another great moment!!!

anyway Thanx for uploading my favorite game of all games

author: The Destati

text: I really liked the atmosphere of this game.  All the way through, it was light-hearted and happy.  While I won't knock the darker storylines of other rpgs, sometimes I just wanna play an rpg that makes me smile all the way through.

text: WAT
author: CMSonYT

text:
For some reason, I didn't really like this game THAT much... I'm on the volcano level now, and I have been enjoying it so far, but I just found it an "okay" game, not a "BESTOFALLTIIIIME" game. 
But, for some reason, my short RPG that I seem to play over and over again is Sonic Chronicles: The Dark Brotherhood. It's not that good, it's full of plotholes, and everything about it is under-polished and when you weigh it out, SMRPG is a much better game. 
But I've played it over. Five times. .~.
author: Jirt

text: Super Mario RPG and the Paper Mario games are some of the most entertaining games I've ever played. Rarely do you see games that can balance drama, comedy, and atmosphere in the way these games do.

text: One of my favorites too! :D
author: The Toolbox Games

text: This is one of the most entertaining RPGs I've ever played. It's a bit too short and easy, but at the same time it might be part of the reason why I replay this game every 2-3 years and never get tired of it. Squaresoft managed to pull off a completely unique atmosphere with this game, sometimes giving the bright Mario universe a darker tone in a masterful way. That, the engaging battle system and an amazing soundtrack from Shimomura makes SMRPG one of my favorites ever.
author: SupraDarky
